snippet: The Japanese manufacturer said the accusations that it knew of defects in its airbags but did not report them confuse “multiple events occurring at different times.”
abstract: Takata issues statement offering 'substantive rebuttal' to accusations by two former employees that company carried out tests on airbags in 2004 in Michigan and found signs of defects but did not report results to federal regulators.
lead_paragraph: The Japanese manufacturer said the accusations that it knew of defects in its airbags but did not report them confuse “multiple events occurring at different times.”

headline.main: Takata Offers Its Rebuttal to Report of Secret Airbag Tests
headline.print_headline: Takata Offers Its Rebuttal To Report Of Secret Test
